We just released the 250th episode of our show, so we’re celebrating with this bonus episode, containing a collection of party-winning jokes from our guests. These laughs (or groans) come courtesy of Jonah Hill, Carrie Brownstein, The Arctic Monkeys, Tavi Gevinson, Jim Jarmusch, Timothy Olyphant, and many more.

title: The 2014 All-Icebreaker Special
description: We just released the 250th episode of our show, so we’re celebrating with this bonus episode, containing a collection of party-winning jokes from our guests. These laughs (or groans) come courtesy of Jonah Hill, Carrie Brownstein, The Arctic Monkeys, Tavi Gevinson, Jim Jarmusch, Timothy Olyphant, and many more. “A Space, Man” – Hugh Bonneville aka […]
contentencoded:
We just released the 250th episode of our show, so we’re celebrating with this bonus episode, containing a collection of party-winning jokes from our guests. These laughs (or groans) come courtesy of Jonah Hill, Carrie Brownstein, The Arctic Monkeys, Tavi Gevinson, Jim Jarmusch, Timothy Olyphant, and many more.


“A Space, Man” – Hugh Bonneville

aka Lord Grantham of “Downton Abbey”


“Two Cupcakes” – Jonah Hill

Oscar nominee for “Wolf Of Wall Street” and “Moneyball”


“Interrupting Feral Pig” – Jonathan Goldstein

Author and host of “Wire Tap”


“Knock Knock x 3” – Daniel Post-Senning & Lizzie Post

Etiquette experts and co-authors of “Emily Post’s Etiquette”


“Waldo’s Stripes” – Judy Greer

Co-star of “The Descendants,” “Arrested Development” & just about everything else


“The Mummy’s Soundtrack” – Joanna Hershon

Author of “A Dual Inheritance”


“The Chiropractor’s Soundtrack” – Annabelle Gurwitch

Author and former host of “Dinner and A Movie”


“A Well-Dressed Gator” – Lance Bangs

Director of rock videos and the Slint documentary “Breadcrumb Trail”


“Dancing Kleenex” – Carrie Brownstein

Co-star/co-creator of TV’s “Portlandia” and ex-frontwoman of Wild Flag and Sleater Kinney


“Hummingbirds” – noah Strycker

Author of “The Thing with Feathers”/professional bird nerd


“Actors on Lightbulbs” – Sam Harris

Actor and author of the memoir “Ham.”


“Hip Lightbulbs” – Jordan Vogt-Roberts

Director of “The Kings of Summer” and “Nick Offerman: American Ham.”


“Ironic Misogynist Joke” – Tavi Gevinson

Feminist, “Rookie” magazine editor-in-chief, and star of the forthcoming Broadway drama “This Is Our Youth.”


“Purple Stuff On Salad” – Steve

Citizen of Salt Lake City and valued DPD listener


“Bar Food” – Jim Jarmusch

Pioneering indie filmmaker/coolest man in world


“A Fun Guy” – Ashley Cardiff

Author of the comedic essay collection “Night Terrors”


“Whispering Peanuts” – Ellin Stein

Comedy historian and author of “That’s Not Funny, That’s Sick: the National Lampoon & The Insurgents Who Captured the Mainstream”


“Hidden Steak” – Steve Okonski

Keyboardist for indie-psych band Diane Coffee


“Drummer At the Door” – Michael Fitzpatrick

Aka “Fitz” of New-Wave soulsters Fitz & the Tantrums


“Shoot the Violinist” – Margaret Batjer

World-renowned violinist and concertmaster of the L.A. Chamber Orchestra


“Penguin Semi-Joke” – Andrew Bujalski

Writer-director of “Computer Chess”/Godfather of “mumblecore”


“Eating Right” – Sherill Tippins

Author of the Chelsea Hotel history “Inside The Dream Palace.”


“Just Kiddin’!” – Timothy Olyphant

Star of TV’s “Justified”


“His Dying Wish(es)” – Carol Leifer

Standup comic, TV comedy writer, perennial Letterman guest, and author of “How to Succeed In Business Without Really Crying”


“Bad Luck Wife” – Gary Shteyngart

Bestselling author of “Absurdistan” and the recent memoir “Little Failure”


“Tough Customers” – Zach Schwartz

Aka Zach Rogue, frontman of the band Rogue Wave


“I’ll Be the Neck” – Lidia Bastianich

Celebrity chef, uber-restaurateur and host of the TV series“Lidia’s Italy”


“Canadian Sex” – Margaret Atwood

Canuck author of the dystopian classics “The Handmaid’s Tale” and the “Oryx and Crake” trilogy


“Wheeled Pirate” – Peaches

Electro-provacateur and creaor of the autobiographical musical “Peaches does Herself”


“Igorance or Apathy?” – Kenny Vance

Pop musician and producer, original member of doo-wop hitmakers Jay & the Americans


“An Only Child” – Baz Luhrmann

Singular writer/director of “Moulin Rouge” and the latest adaptation of “The Great Gatsby”


“Archery” – Austin Brown

Guitarist for punk band Parquet Courts


“Chicken: Surprised” – Sherill Tippins


“Brown & Sticky” – Ben Schott

Compiler/reporter of trivia, and author of “Schott’s Miscellany” and “Schottenfreude”


“Nixon in the Kitchen” – Penny Lane

Director of the documentary “Our Nixon”


“A Swiss Roll” – Alex Turner & Matt Helders

Frontman and drummer, respectively, for UK rock superstars The Arctic Monkeys


“A Little Whine” – Ruth Reichl

Pioneering food writer, last editor-in-chief of “Gourmet” magazine, and author of the new novel “Delicious!”


“Octopus Soldier” – Aaron Aites & Audrey Ewell

Directors of the Occupy Movement documentary “99%” and the black-metal doc “Until the Light Takes Us”


“Six-Legged Beast” – Gideon Benson & Isabella Manfredi

Frontfolk for Aussie rock band The Preatures


“Scary Math” – Lars Ulrich

Co-founder and drummer of Metallica
